alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 2:54AM EDT until April 07 at 9:50PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellow River near Conyers below Milstead affecting Newton and Rockdale Counties. Oconee River near Milledgeville affecting Washington, Wilkinson and Baldwin Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Milledgeville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 22 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs upstream and downstream from the gage located around one half mile upstream from the Georgia Highway 22 and 24 bridge. Low lying portions of woodlands and pasture in the natural flood plain will begin to flood. This will include portions of the sidewalks in the Oconee River Greenway Park just downstream from the bridge. Sinclair Dam will have one to two gates open to reach this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 22.3 feet and steady. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 22 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
